item.title: Thieving Experience[need help]
item.dc:creator: @blk_joe12 blk joe12
item.description:
@blk_joe12 wrote:

[quote=“bl00d furyz, post:3, topic:318297”]No,See

[quote]if(objectID == 2563){
TheifStall(“Fur Stall”, “and recieve a Peice of Gray wolf fur.”, 35, 250*playerLevel[17], 958, 1, 0x340);
}[/quote][/quote]

The ,35, 250*playerlevel

35 = Level to thieve at that stall
250 = is the experience
* = is the multiply symbol but if i take it out it gets nulls in my complier
[/quote]

than dont take out the multiply symbol just change the xp… given… to a smaller number

item.title: Thieving Experience[need help]
item.dc:creator: @Lord_of_fallen_Angel Lord of fallen Angels
item.description:
@Lord_of_fallen_Angel wrote:

Well, in the Java Language, the * Operator is used for timesing Numerals. And since it already has 250exp * 70, just simply take out the “* 70” part which tells the system to keep 250, instead of timesing it by 70.

Read full topic

item.title: Thieving Experience[need help]
item.dc:creator: @bl00d_furyz bl00d furyz
item.description:
@bl00d_furyz wrote:

[center][size=15pt]Thieving Experience[/size][/center]

Based of Source: Delta

What file I need help in: Client.java

What do I need help with: How to change the experience for thieving on stalls + picket pocketing. There is a * for multiply and then ,(level needed for to thieve that stall). You multiply the thieving level you have by the experience you have set up. For example 250exp * 70 = 17,500 experience. But, the the part i need help in is how can i make it a straight forward experience for that specific stall. So instead of 250exp * 70 = 17,500 experience how bout like 250exp per thieve even if u have level 90 or 80 or 72, It doesn’t madder on your level.

[size=12pt]The File coding what the stall looks like:[/size]
if(objectID == 2563){
TheifStall(“Fur Stall”, “and recieve a Peice of Gray wolf fur.”, 35, 250*playerLevel[17], 958, 1, 0x340);
}

Read full topic
